content.raw: Looking at the Jenkins log, this error message occurs only when using bullet, though not with ODE or simbody. Would you be willing to consider leaving this as a console message if I can fix the bullet behavior?
content.html: Looking at the Jenkins log, this error message occurs only when using bullet, though not with ODE or simbody. Would you be willing to consider leaving this as a console message if I can fix the bullet behavior?

content.raw:
Yes, I have been using bullet exclusively the past few days. It still feels weird to have an error message about a physics property within the rendering engine, especially since the rendering engine is used by both sensors and gui.

I would rather this functionality exist in the physics library, and/or as a tool that people can use to validate their models. Then we can check all the models with a command line script, and people who just link against libgazebo-physics can get the benefit of knowing their inertia values are incorrect.

Rendering should display what it is given without commenting on its physical validity. Think of the rendering engine as a library that doesn't know it's attached to physics engine.
content.html:
Yes, I have been using bullet exclusively the past few days. It still feels weird to have an error message about a physics property within the rendering engine, especially since the rendering engine is used by both sensors and gui.

I would rather this functionality exist in the physics library, and/or as a tool that people can use to validate their models. Then we can check all the models with a command line script, and people who just link against libgazebo-physics can get the benefit of knowing their inertia values are incorrect.

Rendering should display what it is given without commenting on its physical validity. Think of the rendering engine as a library that doesn't know it's attached to physics engine.

content.raw:
I fixed the bullet warning in 3c60cfc.

Aside from that, I see your point. My intent was to provide a warning that would appear only when the user enables the `View Center of Mass / Inertia` option on a model with strange inertia. However, it was appearing upon loading the world with no regard to the current view options.

I had converted it back to gzlog, but it can be removed if you prefer.
content.html:
I fixed the bullet warning in 3c60cfc.

Aside from that, I see your point. My intent was to provide a warning that would appear only when the user enables the View Center of Mass / Inertia option on a model with strange inertia. However, it was appearing upon loading the world with no regard to the current view options.

I had converted it back to gzlog, but it can be removed if you prefer.

content.raw: gzlog is fine, thanks for the update.
content.html: gzlog is fine, thanks for the update.
